physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Patient 1 presented with a slowly enlarging, tender, reticulated, erythematous plaque on the left breast. Patient 2 had painful, lacy reticular erythema and telangiectasias on both breasts. Patient 3 exhibited nonhealing painful superficial ulcerations and telangiectasias on the underside of both breasts. Patient 4 showed erythematous to violaceous telangiectatic plaques on both breasts. Patient 5 had a painful erythematous patch with telangiectasias on the right breast.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Patient 1 improved significantly after stent placement. Patient 3 experienced spontaneous improvement in pain and lesions. Patient 4 noted substantial improvement on the left breast and slow improvement on the right breast after treatment with isotretinoin. Patient 5's symptoms improved spontaneously.
